li.a: Secure Your College Student's Credit Future
Secure Your College Student's Credit Future

article.p: Here at Yuma Elementary School District One, we believe education should be an adventure where every child is thrilled to learn. We foster an environment that challenges students to develop their innate talents and abilities to the fullest. We know that investing in our children will enrich our community for years to come.
Learn more about our district and what we have to offer your child on the pages of our website. We invite you to contact us with any questions—we're always happy to help!

We post notices of the Yuma School District One board meetings in the window at the district office located at 450 W. Sixth Street, Yuma, Arizona, 85364. You'll also find notifications on the Governing Board page, and we also send them to the local media via fax.

Use our interactive map by pressing the play button to see which school closest to you is offering grab ’n go meal service. Included on this map are all available locations in Yuma, including Crane School District and Yuma Union High School District locations.

div.p: Governor Doug Ducey and Superintendent of Public Instruction Kathy Hoffman, announced that schools will remain closed through the end of the school year.
Yuma School District One has increased the average teacher salary by 5%.
Thanks to the great partnerships between local organizations and city officials, we were able to plant more than 70 trees on the campuses of Gila Vista and McGraw.

div.div: District One Partners with the 2020 Census

div.p: As a 2020 Census partner, District One is looking forward to offer families the opportunity to complete the census at a school location.

p.style: margin: 0px; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family:

p.span: To protect the health and safety of students, parents, and staff, District One will provide grab ’n go meal service once per week, on Thursdays. At the time of pick up, each child will receive 5 breakfast meals and 5 lunch meals. This ensures children continue to receive the same nutritious meals, while only visiting schools once each week.
The next Grab ‘n Go service is on Thursday, April 23rd

Each child, 18 years old and younger, receiving a meal will still need to be present at the time of pickup on Thursdays. If possible, we encourage families to bring reusable bags, boxes, or other items that may help them transport their meals from school to home.
As a reminder, Crane School District & YUHSD continue to offer daily pick-up.
for a complete list of locations and times.
